meanings.definition: The possibility of suffering harm or injury.
meanings.sent1: Children should be aware of the dangers of playing near busy roads.
meanings.sent2: It is important to educate hikers about the dangers of venturing off marked trails.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel learned about the dangers of stealing nuts from the grumpy old bear.
meanings.sent4: The dangers of gossip can spread faster than a wildfire in a dry forest.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a video to illustrate the dangers of not wearing a seatbelt.

meanings.definition: A cause or source of harm or injury.
meanings.sent1: The slippery floor was a dangers to anyone walking on it.
meanings.sent2: The faulty wiring in the old building posed serious dangers to the residents.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was a constant dangers to the fragile ornaments on the shelf.
meanings.sent4: His reckless behavior became a dangers to himself and those around him.
meanings.sent5: The polluted water was a hidden dangers to the unsuspecting swimmers.
